BOARD OF ZONING APPEAL
HEARING – REMOTE MEETING
~ AGENDA ~

Thursday, November 18, 2021

6:00 PM

Remote Meeting

BOARD OF ZONING APPEAL
City of Cambridge
Massachusetts
BOARD OF ZONING APPEAL
831 Mass Avenue, Cambridge, MA.
617) 349-6100
The Board of Zoning Appeal will hold a Virtual Public Meeting, THURSDAY NOVEMBER 18, 2021. Members of the public can participate or view the meeting
remotely using the Zoom Webinar link:
<https://cambridgema.zoom.us/j/85702655517>
Or join by phone: Dial +1 929 436 2866 or +1 301 715 8592 - Webinar ID:
85702655517
6:30 P.M. CASE NO. BZA-148819
675 WEST KENDALL STREET
Office 3A Zone/PUD-3
BMR-675 WEST KENDALL STREET LLC - C/O AARON D. CONANT, ALNYLAM
PHARMACEUTICALS, INC.
Variance: To install sign violating height and location. Art. 7.000, Sec. 7.16.22
(Height/Wall Sign). Art. 10.000, Sec. 10.30 (Variance).
6:45 P.M. CASE NO. BZA-131935
12 CORPORAL BURNS ROAD
Residence B Zone
OLIVIA WEISSER & CHRIS WILLARD
Special Permit: To build a 3' non-covered stair landing to front entry, there are
existing steps up to entry door with no landing.
Art. 5.000, Sec. 5.31 (Table of Dimensional Requirements). Art. 8.000, Sec. 8.22.2 &
Sec. 8.22.2.D (Non-Conforming Structure).
Art. 10.000, Sec. 10.40 (Special Permit).
7:00 P.M. CASE NO. BZA-148948
34 BUCKINGHAM STREET
Residence A-2 Zone
DAVID LAKATOS & TAMI NGUYEN - C/O EDRICK VANBEUZEKOM, AIA
Variance: To build conforming addition and two dormers on an existing
nonconforming house, increasing the gross floor area by more
than 25%. Art. 5.000, Sec. 5.31 (Table of Dimensional Requirements). Art. 8.000,
Sec. 8.22.3 (Non-Conforming Structure).
Special Permit: Addition of windows on the side of the house which is
nonconforming to the yard requirements.
Art. 8.000, Sec. 8.22.2.C (Non-Conforming Structure).
7:15 P.M. CASE NO. BZA-143277
123 HANCOCK STREET
Residence C-1 Zone
MSW HANCOCK LLC - C/O SAM WOLFF
Variance: To build an addition to, and to convert an existing 2 family dwelling
into a three-family dwelling.
Art. 5.000, Sec. 5.31 (Table of Dimensional Requirements) Sec. 5.22.1 (Open Space)
Sec. 5.26 (Conversion). Art. 10.000, Sec. 10.30 (Variance).
7:30 P.M. CASE NO. BZA-149721

Board of Zoning Appeal

November 18, 2021

54 PARK AVENUE
Residence B Zone
ROTHFUCHS DEVELOPMENT, INC. - C/O SARAH LIKE RHATIGAN, ESQ.
Variance: Demolition of existing, unsafe, two-family, non-conforming structure
and construction of a new single-family dwelling.
Reducing pre-existing non-conforming garage within the setbacks. Art. 5.000,
Sec. 5.31 (Table of Dimensional Requirements).
Art. 4.000, Sec. 4.21 (Accessory Structure). Art. 10.000, Sec. 10.30 (Variance).
Special Permit: To maintain the existing driveway which is less than 5' from the
property line.
Art. 6.000, Sec. 6.441.B.G (Driveway Setbacks). Art. 10.000, Sec. 10.40 (Special
Permit).
7:45 P.M. CASE NO. BZA-149665
38 MT. PLEASANT STREET
Residence C-1 Zone
MATTHEW T. RUSSELL & LINDSEY M. RUSSELL - C/O CHRISTOPHER J. ALPHEN,
ESQ.
Special Permit: To build a second-floor addition over existing first floor kitchen
and to replace/relocate windows.
Art. 5.000, Sec. 5.31 (Table of Dimensional Requirements). Art. 8.000, Sec. 8.22.2.D
(Non-Conforming Structure),
Sec. 8.22.2.C (Alteration Non-Conforming Structure). Art. 10.000, Sec. 10.40
(Special Permit).
8:00 P.M. CASE NO. BZA-149683
2 FROST STREET - UNIT 2 Residence B Zone
JOSHUA GOODMAN & ANNA LUMELSKY - C/O CHRISTOPHER J. ALPHEN, ESQ.
Variance: To build additions to the first, second and third levels.
Art. 5.000, Sec. 5.31 (Table of Dimensional Requirements). Art. 10.000, Sec. 10.30
(Variance).
Special Permit: To add/alter windows within the setback. Art. 8.000, Sec.
8.22.2.C (Alteration Non-Conforming Structure).
Art. 10.000, Sec. 10.40 (Special Permit).
8:15 P.M. CASE NO. BZA-150580
1815 MASSACHUSETTS AVENUE
Business C Zone/ Mass
Ave Overlay, Lesley Porter Overlay
LESLEY UNIVERSITY - CELLCO PARTNERSHIP D/B/A VERIZON WIRELESS, C/O
TIMOTHY C. TWARDOWSKI, ESQ.
Special Permit: To modify its existing mobile communications facility by removing
and replacing eight antennas (two per sector) and repositioning four existing
antennas (one per sector). All replacement and existing antennas and
associated cables will be wrapped or painted to match the building façade in
terms of the solid red color.
Art. 4.000, Sec. 4.32.G.1 & Sec. 4.40 (Footnote 49) (Telecommunication Facility).
Art. 10.000, Sec. 10.40-10.46 (Special Permit).
6409A - Middle Class Tax Relief and Job Creation act (aka Spectrum Act).

Original Hearing Date: 01/09/20 & 07/23/20
544 MASS AVENUE
CENTRAL SQUARE REDEVELOPMENT LLC
C/O CLIFFORD SCHORER
Variance: To build a 29-unit micro-studio apartment building.
6:00 P.M. - BZA-017315-2020
SIX MONTH EXTENSION REQUEST
Original Hearing Date 9/24/20 &
10/22/20
Decision filed on 12/09/2020 11 LOPEZ STREET
MACIEJ GADAMSKI C/O SARAH L. RHATIGAN, ESQ.
Variance: To construct additions squaring-off front of the existing structure
and adding third floor, extend rear deck within side setback, add retaining
walls with guardrails within front setback.
TO VIEW BZA CASE APPLICATIONS, PLANS & SUBMISSIONS, GO TO:
<https://www.cambridgema.gov/inspection/zoning.aspx> at top of page, click
“Calendar” > Click hearing date >
Click “Board of Zoning Appeal Agenda.” Any information filed after the agenda has
been posted can be viewed at the Inspectional Services Department located at 831 Mass
Avenue, Cambridge by
appointment only. Copies of this petition are also on file in the office of the City Clerk,
City Hall, Cambridge, MA. Interested persons may provide comments to the Board of
Zoning Appeal by
participating virtually during the hearing and/or may provide written comments for
the Board’s consideration by mailing or delivering them to the attention of the
Secretary, Board of Zoning Appeal,
831 Mass Avenue, 02139 or by emailing them to mpacheco@cambridgema.gov
<mailto:mpacheco@cambridgema.gov>. Comments must be submitted prior to the Hearing
and include the Case Number.
Continued cases are not re-advertised but are posted on the office board at the City
Clerk’s Office in City Hall & on the same BZA Web Page 48 hours prior to hearing.

City of Cambridge

cambridgema.gov
